description: A historical appreciation of the impact of the exploration, colonization, and immigration of other peoples on French national consciousness, from the 16th century to the present. Emphasis is on the role of the Other in fostering critiques of French culture and society. Readings include travel literature, anthropological treatises, novels, and historical documents. Oral presentations and several short papers are included in the course.
name: FRENCH MODERNISM: French Modernism: From Gaugin to Genet

section.name: FRENCH MODERNISM: French Modernism: From Gaugin to Genet
